images.caption: Figure 1:TheAInsteinframework. An input scientific abstract (ùíú\mathcal{A}) is first derived into a generalized problem (ùí´\mathcal{P}) by the Generalizer agent (ùí¢\mathcal{G}). The Solver agent (ùíÆ\mathcal{S}) then attempts to derive a technical solution (ùíµ\mathcal{Z}), using the problem statementùí´\mathcal{P}. Both phases employ an iterative refinement loop with internal (‚Ñ≥i\mathcal{M}_{i}) and external (‚Ñ≥e\mathcal{M}_{e}) critique.Note:The transitionùíú‚Üíùí´\mathcal{A}\to\mathcal{P}follows the same iterative refinement mechanism, where the the ‚ÄúHappy‚Äù condition is as described in Section3.2.
Figure 2:Correlation matrix for Generalizer quality metrics. The deficit score (dd) is strongly correlated with Information Loss and Ambiguity.

Figure 3:Performance comparison of internal models across ICLR paper tiers (Oral, Spotlight, Poster), averaging acrossGPT-OSS-120Bas the external model.
